item.title: Tracy add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Tracy add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Gordon A. Eadie
item.description: "If you don't stand for something you will fall for anything." -- Gordon A. Eadie

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Allen Saunders
item.description: "Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans." -- Allen Saunders

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Theodore Roosevelt
item.description: "Do what you can, with what you have, where you are." -- Theodore Roosevelt

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Miss Piggy
item.description: "Beauty is in the eye of the beholder and it may be necessary from time to time to give a stupid or misinformed beholder a black eye." -- Miss Piggy

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I do not want people to be very agreeable, as it saves me the trouble of liking them a great deal." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Finish each day and be done with it. You have done what you could. Some blunders and absurdities no doubt crept in; forget them as soon as you can. Tomorrow is a new day. You shall begin it serenely and with too high a spirit to be encumbered with your old nonsense." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Reality is merely an illusion, albeit a very persistent one." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "A lie can travel half way around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Tracy add a quote by E.B. White
item.description: "If the world were merely seductive, that would be easy. If it were merely challenging, that would be no problem. But I arise in the morning torn between a desire to improve the world and a desire to enjoy the world. This makes it hard to plan the day." -- E.B. White

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Arthur Schopenhauer
item.description: "Talent hits a target no one else can hit. Genius hits a target no one else can see." -- Arthur Schopenhauer

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well".
From: "More Maxims of Mark" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt
